summary: The document is a classified SECRET record under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, detailing Luis POSADA's employment status in 1966. It reveals his dual roles: employment with a Cuban exile organization in Miami and being paid by another entity to report on activities, suggesting espionage. The document also notes the necessity to record POSADA's resignation from Gri-state Engineering Service, effective 31 July 1966.
key_findings: Luis POSADA was employed by a Cuban exile organization in Miami in 1966.
He was also being paid by another entity to report on activities, indicating possible espionage.
POSADA's resignation from Gri-state Engineering Service is recommended to be recorded and made effective 31 July 1966.
The document is classified as SECRET and pertains to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
